humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there are 11 lymph nodes in total, with 2 out of 11 lymph nodes positive for metastatic carcinoma (2/11). This corresponds to N1 based on the AJCC staging system (New Rule 12). The report states 'METASTATIC CARCINOMA INVOLVING ONE OUT OF ONE LYMPH NODE (1/1)' for sentinel nodes 1 and 3, which means 2 out of the total 11 lymph nodes are positive. The other lymph nodes, including sentinel node 2 and 9 additional lymph nodes, are all benign (0/9).

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic carcinoma involving 2 out of 13 lymph nodes (2/13) in the left axilla. This corresponds to a pathologic N1 stage. The first sentinel node had metastatic carcinoma (1/1), the second was benign (0/1), and the third had metastatic carcinoma (1/1). Nine additional benign lymph nodes were identified in levels I and II of the left axilla (0/9). The total number of lymph nodes involved is 2, which is less than 3, so the N stage is N1.
